name: py-black
description:
Black is the uncompromising Python code formatter. By using it, you
agree to cede control over minutiae of hand-formatting. In return, Black
gives you speed, determinism, and freedom from pycodestyle nagging about
formatting.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools-scm
dependencies.description: The blessed package to manage your versions by scm tags.

dependencies.name: py-click
dependencies.description: Python composable command line interface toolkit.

dependencies.name: py-platformdirs
dependencies.description:
A small Python module for determining appropriate platform-specific
dirs, e.g. a "user data dir"

dependencies.name: py-tomli
dependencies.description:
Tomli is a Python library for parsing TOML. Tomli is fully compatible
with TOML v1.0.0.

dependencies.name: py-typed-ast
dependencies.description: A fork of Python 2 and 3 ast modules with type comment support.

dependencies.name: py-pathspec
dependencies.description:
pathspec extends the test loading and running features of unittest,
making it easier to write, find and run tests.

dependencies.name: py-dataclasses
dependencies.description: A backport of the dataclasses module for Python 3.6

dependencies.name: py-typing-extensions
dependencies.description:
The typing_extensions module contains both backports of these changes as
well as experimental types that will eventually be added to the typing
module, such as Protocol (see PEP 544 for details about protocols and
static duck typing).

dependencies.name: py-mypy-extensions
dependencies.description:
Experimental type system extensions for programs checked with the mypy
typechecker.

dependencies.name: py-aiohttp
dependencies.description:
Supports both client and server side of HTTP protocol. Supports both
client and server Web-Sockets out-of-the-box and avoids Callbacks.
Provides Web-server with middlewares and plugable routing.

dependencies.name: py-uvloop
dependencies.description: uvloop is a fast, drop-in replacement of the built-in asyncio event

dependencies.name: py-ipython
dependencies.description:
IPython provides a rich toolkit to help you make the most out of using
Python interactively.

dependencies.name: py-tokenize-rt
dependencies.description: A wrapper around the stdlib `tokenize` which roundtrips.

dependent_to.name: spack
dependent_to.description:
Spack is a multi-platform package manager that builds and installs
multiple versions and configurations of software. It works on Linux,
macOS, and many supercomputers. Spack is non-destructive: installing a
new version of a package does not break existing installations, so many
configurations of the same package can coexist.

dependent_to.name: py-ipython
dependent_to.description:
IPython provides a rich toolkit to help you make the most out of using
Python interactively.

dependent_to.name: py-setuptools-cpp
dependent_to.description: Simplified packaging for pybind11-based C++ extensions

dependent_to.name: py-torchgeo
dependent_to.description:
TorchGeo: datasets, transforms, and models for geospatial data. TorchGeo
is a PyTorch domain library, similar to torchvision, that provides
datasets, transforms, samplers, and pre-trained models specific to
geospatial data.
